meanings.definition: The ethical theory that the best action is the one that maximizes overall happiness.
meanings.sent1: Utilitarianisms suggest that the most moral choice is the one that brings the most joy to everyone.
meanings.sent2: Many people follow utilitarianisms to ensure their decisions benefit the greater good.
meanings.sent3: In a world governed by utilitarianisms, happiness becomes the ultimate goal for all actions.
meanings.sent4: The concept of utilitarianisms paints a picture of a society focused on collective well-being.
meanings.sent5: Imagine a world where utilitarianisms guide every decision, leading to a harmonious and joyful existence for all.

meanings.definition: The belief that the usefulness of an action is the basis for determining its moral worth.
meanings.sent1: Utilitarianisms emphasize the importance of actions that serve a practical purpose.
meanings.sent2: When faced with a dilemma, some people turn to utilitarianisms to assess the value of their choices.
meanings.sent3: A humorous take on utilitarianisms would involve a character constantly evaluating the usefulness of their every move.
meanings.sent4: In a metaphorical sense, utilitarianisms act as a compass guiding individuals towards morally valuable decisions.
meanings.sent5: The concept of utilitarianisms can be likened to a tool that helps people navigate the complexities of ethical dilemmas.
